text: Head to the "Cloudedge Bastion Ruins" Eye of Twilight and continue your adventure

title: Mission Description
content: At the moment of Seliose's defeat, both Hyacine and Mem sensed a strange happening in Okhema at the same time. Our window of consideration is narrowing by the second.

text: Meanwhile, in the Eye of Twilight...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hyacine...? What happened?

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Coreflame in my hand... it's trembling. It's sending me a warning...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Phainon, in Amphoreus's mythology, isn't the Dawn Device said to be a gift from Aquila to Kephale?

speaker: Phainon
line: Why bring this up now? Let's focus on getting back down there...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...Lord Phainon!

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes. Nearly every mythologist agrees that "Aquila gifted the Dawn Device to Kephale."

speaker: Hyacine
line: Everyone, calm down... listen to me.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Coreflame in my hand trembles violently, its warmth slipping away like sand through my fingers.

speaker: Hyacine
line: It burned through immense energy just to leave me with one message: The Dawn Device... is extinguished.

text: What do you mean by that?
This isn't something to joke about...

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: It's not a joke, Grayie...

text: Who's responsible for this?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: I... don't know.

speaker: Phainon
line: If the Coreflame's message is true, Okhema has lost the Dawn Device's protection...

speaker: Phainon
line: Darkness will consume the holy city in an instant... and the aftermath will be devastating.

speaker: Mem
line: Phainon... I feel something too...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You sense it as well?

speaker: Mem
line: While Hyacine was speaking... countless streams of memories rose beneath our feet, spiraling into the sky...

speaker: Mem
line: There are so many, so heavy... Even through the fortress walls, I can still hear them clearly...

speaker: Mem
line: Birds, nymphs, people... their memories tangled together, their cries echoing as one.

speaker: Phainon
line: Could this be because of the Titan's fall? That doesn't make any sense...

speaker: Hyacine
line: There's no time to dwell on the cause! Without the light of the Dawn Device, the holy city will be consumed by darkness, and countless lives will be cast adrift...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Everyone, you must return and fulfill the mission of Chrysos Heirs. As for me...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Dannie, you're still carrying Phagousa's spirit water, aren't you?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: What...?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: That was just a precaution... It's not the time...

speaker: Hyacine
line: No, the time has come. Open the path to the Vortex for me. There's still one last thing I can do for the people down there...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Return the Coreflame of Aquila and inherit their divine authority...

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'll remain in the sky and cast my protection over the people.

text: You're... staying?

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Yes. I'm afraid this is a goodbye, Grayie...

text: There must be another way!

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: Don't waste time thinking about alternatives. This... this will resolve everything.

text: We'll go with you. It's the fastest way.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: That might not be possible. "The entrance serves as the exit"... It's a one-way passage. You need to return to the holy city and deliver Kephale's Coreflame.

children.speaker: Hyacine
children.line: And an entrance created this way... only has space for one person, doesn't it?

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...Yeah.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Dannie, I'm counting on you.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...I understand.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: "...Under the raucous steps of their frenzied dance, the roar of celebration hides the world's heartbeat."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: "Spirit water, reveal the way."

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Dawn, Shine at the World's End.mp4

speaker: Dan Heng
line: "At the end of the rainbow bridge, the Skyfolk will mend dusk and dawn."

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Lady Tribios's prophecy... It seems it didn't fail after all.

speaker: Hyacine
line: It still feels unreal, even after seeing it a second time...

speaker: Hyacine
line: You'd move in perfect harmony with the rivers and seas of this world.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ But we can't stay. (Trailblazer) and I... we have people waiting for us, a home calling us back.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Astral Express, isn't it?

speaker: Hyacine
line: March 7th, the one you always mention... I'd like to meet her someday.

text: I'm sure the two of you would get along wonderfully.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I can almost see the three of you traveling together, laughing and sharing moments.

text: And you, Hyacine? Do you not feel sadness?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Of course, I do. A sharp, aching sadness... I feel every bit of it.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Why hide it? No one here would mock you for showing true vulnerability.

speaker: Hyacine
line: As a healer from the Twilight Courtyard, Dan Heng, it's my duty to stay composed in front of those suffering from illness. A sorrowful expression would only add to their burden.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The world I love is the one suffering now. How could I face it with a frown?

text: Farewell, Hyacinthia.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Goodbye, everyone...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Please, become the heroes this world needs. And as for the final "blank page" of this epic, the lives and stories of ordinary mortals...

speaker: Hyacine
line: I'll guard them, until the very end.

text: A few days ago, in Okhema's "Twilight Courtyard"...

speaker: Clementine
line: Miss Hyacine... are you really leaving?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Yes! Lord Phainon has already set the date for our departure. As a descendant of the Sky hero, I must prepare myself and carry this responsibility.

speaker: Clementine
line: What about this new Twilight Courtyard?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Believe in yourself, Clementine! You're an exceptional healer, more than capable of handling things on your own.

speaker: Hyacine
line: The patients trust you, and you've earned that trust... That's what matters, isn't it?

speaker: Tribbie
line: Miss Clementine's medical skills are amazing! We believe you'll make the Twilight Courtyard proud!

speaker: Clementine
line: Thank you, Lady Tribbie! I... I'll do my best.

speaker: Clementine
line: I just... don't have the same confidence and certainty as Miss Hyacine. No matter how severe the illness or injury, she always faces it with a smile...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Honestly... I'm not confident about everything, Clementine.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I've just learned how to hide my unease well — it's a skill I consider essential.

speaker: Clementine
line: It's hard to imagine anything making Miss Hyacine feel uncertain.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Well... shall I give you an example? Since Lady Tribbie happens to be here too...

speaker: Tribbie
line: ...Wait, we're part of this?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Look at the Flame-Chase Journey. Since Lady Aglaea took over the leadership of Okhema, every Chrysos Heir entrusted with a Coreflame — aside from Professor Anaxa — was personally chosen by her.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I was the outlier... The hero Seliose entrusted her bloodline with the legacy of the "Sky." Lady Aglaea's thoughts on my potential remained a mystery, even up till the day she left.

speaker: Hyacine
line: So I've always carried a lingering doubt about my ability to fulfill this role.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Heh...

speaker: Clementine
line: Lady Tribbie... Why are you laughing?

speaker: Tribbie
line: The answer Cinny wants is simple! Just try looking at it from another perspective.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Imagine this: Knowing Agy's personality, if she believed you weren't worthy...

speaker: Tribbie
line: Don't you think she would have considered other plans?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Heh... now that I think about it, I feel much better.

speaker: Clementine
line: I may not have Lady Aglaea's keen judgment, but I would never question your resolve, Miss Hyacine.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Thank you, Clementine!

speaker: Hyacine
line: I had a sudden thought, Lady Tribbie. Before I depart, can you teach me the words for returning the Coreflame?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I've always been at the Grove helping with lectures and never had the chance to come to Okhema... The phrases everyone has memorized still feel unfamiliar to me.

speaker: Hyacine
line: I don't want to embarrass myself in front of everyone when it's my turn to return the Coreflame.

speaker: Tribbie
line: It's easy! We can teach you right now. Let's go — we will say a line, and you repeat after us.

speaker: Tribbie
line: "O majesty of the Twelve Titans."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "O majesty of the Twelve Titans..."

speaker: Tribbie
line: "Pillars of the world."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "Pillars of the world..."

speaker: Tribbie
line: "We seek your divinity."

speaker: Hyacine
line: "We seek your divinity..."

speaker: Hyacine & Trinnon
line: "...To mend the rifts of the world—"

speaker: Hyacine & Trinnon
line: "Fill our bodies with blood of gold..."

speaker: Hyacine & Trinnon
line: "Till we wither in willing service to the prophecy."

speaker: Trinnon
line: Surrender the Coreflame, Chrysos Heir.

text: (Submit Coreflame of Sky)

speaker: Little Ica
line: Doot... doot, doot-doot!

speaker: Trinnon
line: Cinny, are they...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lord Solabis, Lady Lunabis...

speaker: Hyacine
line: The mission of the Skyfolk has been completed... Your watch can finally come to an end.

speaker: Lunabis
line: We thank you, Miss Hyacine...

speaker: Solabis
line: Even though we were the source of that false legend, you still brought us freedom.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Please don't say that. Without your wings, we would have struggled to progress in the Eye of Twilight.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Okhema is on the brink, and I must quickly embrace the role of demigod to protect everyone with the power of the Sky.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Honored ones, please tell me... what trials lie ahead for me to complete?

speaker: Lunabis
line: I think you've already done everything you were meant to, Miss Hyacine.

speaker: Lunabis
line: What do you think... Seliose?

speaker: Voice of the Sky
line: The Skyfolk...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Lady Seliose?

speaker: Hyacine
line: I see... after all these long years, your will has merged with the Titan's divinity.

speaker: Voice of the Sky
line: I... deeply regret...

speaker: Voice of the Sky
line: I... beg for forgiveness...

speaker: Voice of the Sky
line: The darkness in the human heart... clouded my judgment...

speaker: Voice of the Sky
line: I failed to recognize... the resilience buried deep within...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...Of those present that day, I don't know how many were innocent, how many truly deserved their fate.

speaker: Hyacine
line: That's why I cannot forgive you on their behalf, Lady Seliose...

speaker: Hyacine
line: The spirits of my ancestors resonated with me. You exiled our people, and they may never forgive you for that, but...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...At least there is one thing we can agree on. The truth that no one can distort —

speaker: Hyacine
line: The courage it took to defy the gods was undeniable, unwavering. That same spirit now lives on in those who walk the Flame-Chase Journey, growing stronger with every step.

speaker: Crispus
line: You were the spark that set this era in motion, Seliose...

speaker: General Ektra
line: An age where heroes rise and epic stories are told far and wide...

speaker: Jacyntha
line: An age where a flame of hope was preserved for the world.

speaker: Voice of the Sky
line: Hehe...

speaker: Voice of the Sky
line: Perhaps... this is what I longed for...

speaker: Voice of the Sky
line: Now, I can finally rest in peace...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Even in that darkest moment, Lady Seliose, you still held compassion for mortals, didn't you?

speaker: Hyacine
line: Even with the Titan's power... you didn't punish the world by letting the Sky fall. I imagine you were waiting for someone to bring redemption.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Trust me with the power of the Sky. I am merely a healer. I could never match your strength even with that power...

speaker: Hyacine
line: Thankfully... the world no longer needs a demigod who can summon thunder and storms. What I must do is merge with the Sky, and...

speaker: Hyacine
line: ...Cast down a gentle rainbow, protecting as many lives as I can.

speaker: Hyacine
line: Professor Anaxa... do you remember that lesson?

speaker: Hyacine
line: In the end, I followed the path of my ancestors, returning to the Sky... I didn't return to the earth, to walk with the people.

speaker: Hyacine
line: But even so...

speaker: Hyacine
line: I still achieved my dream.

speaker: Phainon
line: Hyacinthia... thank you.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The sky is burning.

speaker: Phainon
line: Okhema's Dawn has come to an end...

speaker: Phainon
line: Why is this happening...?

text: Can Hyacine fix the sky...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: No... it's too late. This sky has been completely swallowed by the black tide...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: This darkness... Its power probably surpasses that of the Titans.

text: Was this not predicted in the prophecy?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Tribbie would have made sure to warn us if there were any mention of it.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Even if Hyacine takes the divine authority of the sky, she probably won't be able to banish this darkness...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: The black tide... its power probably surpasses even that of the Titans.

speaker: Phainon
line: All we can do is hope she can protect as many lives as possible...

speaker: Mem
line: Is this... the end for Okhema...?

speaker: Phainon
line: Don't give up. We're the ones leading this journey... so we can't afford to lose our way.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The unexpected is always part of our journey. We'll stay with Okhema until the end, no matter what.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Over there — do you see it? The broken structures look like they've turned transparent...

speaker: Phainon
line: I've never seen anything like this before... Could the black tide be the cause? There are too many things we don't understand... and don't have time to figure out.

speaker: Phainon
line: We can't delay any longer... Let's head down. Hopefully, Kephale's Coreflame is still safe...

speaker: Phainon
line: I'm confident that Miss Cipher will do everything in her power to fulfill her duty.

text: Use Oronyx's Prayer to move the rubble

title: Step Description
content: I created a passage to the Vortex of Genesis with spirit water. Hyacine will claim Aquila's divine authority and bid farewell to everyone. Meanwhile, we'll rush back to Okhema to provide support.

speaker: Phainon
line: The transport platform's route is blocked by rubble...

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ (Trailblazer)! Help buy us some time!

text: Get down the mountain

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The rubble blocking the path has been cleared.

speaker: Phainon
line: Good job. Now we can get off the mountain.

text: (Continue forward)

speaker: Phainon
line: A black tide creature... at Dawncloud!?

speaker: Phainon
line: Oh no, the people in the city!

speaker: Phainon
line: We must find out where they breached the city from...

speaker: Phainon
line: Tribbie! Please hold on till we get back!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: More enemies. It doesn't look great down there...

speaker: Phainon
line: Anyone who dares stand in our way... will get a taste of Dawnmaker's edge.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Phainon
line: Over there! Kephale's Coreflame is being kept in the center of the Council.

speaker: Phainon
line: We must retrieve it and bring it back to the Vortex of Genesis.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: You mean...

speaker: Phainon
line: Right. Worst case scenario... We need to be prepared to return Kephale's Coreflame.

speaker: Phainon
line: If the end is indeed upon us, we no longer have time to investigate the truth behind the miracle — we'll have to trust that Professor Anaxa's hypothesis is the only option.

speaker: Phainon
line: Apologies, Aglaea... I promised you that I would leave the choice of Era Nova to the people of Amphoreus...

speaker: Phainon
line: But I'm afraid there's no room for doubts now.

text: Obtain Kephale's Coreflame

title: Step Description
content: Evernight has descended upon the holy city, bringing disturbing chaos in its wake. With just one final Coreflame to return, completing the "Era Nova" may be our only choice in this crisis. After retrieving Kephale's Coreflame, we will immediately head to the Vortex of Genesis.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Hyacine... Did she make it?

speaker: Phainon
line: Her will to heal the world is so strong...

speaker: Phainon
line: We'll definitely sense it if she's succeeded.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is that...

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Caenis
line: O Sky Father Kephale, please forgive these ignorant and lowly children of humanity...

speaker: Caenis
line: They are so utterly naive that they think of the golden-blooded heretics as Deliverers...

speaker: Caenis
line: This bloodred sky, and the raging flames and demons throughout the land, will purge their foolishness...

speaker: Phainon
line: Caenis...

speaker: Caenis
line: Ah... Lord "Deliverer"?

speaker: Caenis
line: Why don't you join me in praying to the benevolent Kephale...?

speaker: Caenis
line: Cast your eyes on this ravaged land... All of this, sins committed by you blasphemous heretics...

text: She... looks like she's got a screw loose.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Mm... We should not waste our time on a pitiful madwoman.

text: Time to avenge Aglaea.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: We have more important matters to attend to... We shouldn't waste our time on a pitiful madwoman.

text: You are turning everything upside down!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ...No need to argue. We're just wasting our time on a pitiful madwoman.

speaker: Phainon
line: Dan Heng is right. My sword yearns to end your pathetic life...

speaker: Phainon
line: But to a cornered dog like you, the most deserving punishment is to personally witness the Chrysos Heirs fulfill their mission.

speaker: Phainon
line: Only then... will you truly know how meaningless and foolish your past transgressions were.

speaker: Caenis
line: Heh... Fulfill your mission?

speaker: Caenis
line: Kephale's Coreflame is long lost to the winds. How will you... fulfill the prophecy?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Lost to the winds...?

speaker: Phainon
line: She's gone completely mad... to the point where she's just spewing nonsense.

speaker: Phainon
line: For the longest time, Kephale's Coreflame has been worshiped here... Only core members of the Council of Elders know how to activate the Coreflame Casket.

text: How're we gonna find a core member now?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: No... There's no need for such trouble.

text: We'll just have to force Caenis to help us.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: No... We don't need her help.

text: That Lygus, should we seek him out?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: No... There's no need to go through that effort.

speaker: Phainon
line: Professor Anaxa taught me more than just what was in the textbooks.

text: Unlock the Arcane Seal to open the Coreflame Casket
(Speak with Caenis, optional)

speaker: Caenis
line: The sins of the Chrysos Heirs... have finally transformed into divine punishment...

speaker: Caenis
line: None of us... no one can escape...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ Leave her, (Trailblazer)... Focus on the objective.

text: (If the player attempts to leave)

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ Where are you going, (Trailblazer)?

speaker: Phainon
line: Come back. We need your powers to open the Coreflame Casket.

text: (Interact with the Coreflame Casket)

speaker: Phainon
line: During his time at Dawncloud, Professor Anaxa conducted... surveys in various areas.

speaker: Phainon
line: I still remember the words he used. I hope it works.

speaker: Phainon
line: "All-Knowing Father who bears the world, please share a glimpse of your merciful gaze with me."

speaker: Phainon
line: "Cast down the Titan's fire that hangs at the pinnacle of the world, for your devout creations to behold."

speaker: Phainon
line: ...It worked.

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ One step left... To undo its arcane seal... (Trailblazer), I may require your strength again.

text: (While solving the Coreflame Casket)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: (The Path of "Remembrance" holds the power to suspend time in a given area... Maybe that could help...)

text: Obtain Kephale's Coreflame

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...We did it!

speaker: Phainon
line: Take the Coreflame and let's hurry down the mountain!

speaker: Caenis
line: Hah... Hahah...

text: (Investigate the Coreflame of Worldbearing)

speaker: Phainon
line: Dan Heng, can you use the spirit water art again?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I've used up all the spirit water I brought. And...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Just now, after we left the Eye of Twilight... I felt the waters of Amphoreus severing their connection with me.

speaker: Phainon
line: Is this also a result of the black tide...? Looks like all we can do is sprint down the mountain.

speaker: Caenis
line: Heh... You all thought... I completely lost my mind?

speaker: Caenis
line: If the Coreflame was never tampered with, and has always remained here untouched...

speaker: Caenis
line: You all think... I wouldn't have the power to take it away?

speaker: Caenis
line: Ha... Hahahaha!!!

text: Uh oh, looks like it's end of the line for us...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Calm down... and think carefully.

text: Where should we go to look for the Coreflame...?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Calm down... and think carefully.

text: Madness! I will strike her down for you!!!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ▶ (Trailblazer), calm down!

speaker: Cipher
line: "I'll do my job, so you..."

speaker: Cipher
line: "Need to make sure you don't die before you pay me."

speaker: Phainon
line: ...There's no need to worry about the Coreflame's whereabouts. Let's just descend the mountain.

speaker: Mem
line: No need to worry? But...

speaker: Phainon
line: Before setting off to defeat Aquila, I entrusted Miss Cipher with the task of protecting Kephale's Coreflame while we were gone... by any means necessary.

speaker: Phainon
line: If the Coreflame isn't here... that means she must have done something to it. In other words... she fulfilled her duty using her own means.

speaker: Phainon
line: We just have to focus on getting to the Vortex of Genesis, and Cipher will meet us there for sure.

text: You trust her that much?
What if something happened to her...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But if she wasn't successful...

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ Dan Heng, (Trailblazer) — we have no choice other than to trust her.

speaker: Phainon
line: If the nearest ritual basin is ten thousand paces away... then what we have to do is to run in that direction and hope she meets us after one thousand paces.

speaker: Phainon
line: If she doesn't show up, we will keep going... and trust that we will see her at two thousand paces.

speaker: Phainon
line: Three, four, five thousand... I will keep hoping with the same resolve, all the way...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Until she shows up in front of us, with her usual rebellious attitude.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...I understand.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: At least, to this day... I don't recall any Chrysos Heirs failing their mission for the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...She will be no exception.

speaker: Phainon
line: But before that... we must survive and break through this siege!

text: Of course, partner!
You have to trust us too!
Another apocalypse? Been there, done that!
(Enter battle against Black Tide's Champion ×1, Black Tide's Corroded Axe ×2, Black Tide's Decrepit Bow ×2, Black Tide Council ×2, Tide-Eroded Blade ×3 )

speaker: Phainon
line: It's done. Let's go, we...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Phainon.

speaker: Phainon
line: Ah...

text: A fate well deserved.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Perhaps, but...

text: She was a formidable foe to the end.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Her actions may have been deplorable, but...

text: I will not shed a single tear for her.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: She may not have sought sympathy from others, but...

speaker: Phainon
line: As a "Cleaner", she was willing to absorb a millennium of identities and memories for an objective that hasn't changed in that time... I suppose this is also a form of extreme but twisted resilience?

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go... It's time to leave this place.

text: Continue forward and return to Marmoreal Palace

title: Step Description
content: Black Tide Creatures, along with the Flame Reaver, are closing in step by step, yet Kephale's Coreflame remains nowhere to be found. We choose to trust Cipher, who was entrusted with the Coreflame, and keep running toward Marmoreal Palace.

speaker: Mem
line: Everyone, can we run faster?

speaker: Mem
line: I've got a bad feeling!

text: (Interact with Caenis, optional)
The leader of the "Cleaners" fell into an eternal slumber, her death so peaceful that it fomented resentment.
Perhaps, at the distant end of the west wind, there will be a just law that can convict the sins of infesting this elder's soul.
(Approach the marked location)

speaker: Mem
line: E—Everyone!

speaker: Mem
line: Look, behind us...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Flame Reaver...

speaker: Phainon
line: In the end... they still showed up.

text: Now's not the time for a fight...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I agree...

text: You gonna test the results of your training?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: No... Now is not the time.

speaker: Phainon
line: I've been waiting for a chance to face them head-on...

speaker: Phainon
line: But not now... If we take the fight here, then lose... the consequences would be irreversible.

speaker: Phainon
line: Come on... We have to get out of here.

speaker: Phainon
line: Keep running... and never turn back!

text: Escape quickly and return to Marmoreal Palace

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Janus's Hidden Passage — we have to use it to cross Theosphere Lake!

text: (Continue forward)

speaker: Phainon
line: They will catch up to us sooner or later...

speaker: Phainon
line: Keep running. Don't stop!

speaker: Startled Citizen
line: It's him! Lord Phainon!

speaker: Terrified Citizen
line: Wh... What in the world happened!?

speaker: Phainon
line: Retreat to the temple! Protect your family and friends!

speaker: Phainon
line: The chaos will soon cease... I promise you!

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: How did they...

speaker: "Flame Reaver"
line: Dusk... has descended as ordained...

speaker: "Flame Reaver"
line: This world... must... be reset...

speaker: Phainon
line: Clones, illusions... nothing but cheap tricks to help you hide in the shadows.

speaker: "Flame Reaver"
line: The Sky... has returned to its rightful place...

speaker: Mem
line: What... What are they talking about!?

speaker: Phainon
line: The end you seek... is also the Miracle of Genesis?

speaker: Phainon
line: If so, you should be standing alongside the Chrysos Heirs! Why do you hinder us, "Flame Reaver"?

speaker: "Flame Reaver"
line: Dusk... has descended as ordained...

speaker: "Flame Reaver"
line: Must... reset...

text: Just give up on talking sense to them...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: The lack of reason... can't be overcome.

text: It's time to show off the fruits of your training, Phainon.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: In the end... direct confrontation was inevitable.

text: They keep repeating themself like that...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: If words won't work... then we can only express our resolve with our blades.

speaker: Phainon
line: We shoulder the fates and futures of too many people...

speaker: Phainon
line: We... will not fall here!

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Leave this to Castorice and me.

children.speaker: Tribbie
children.line: Snowy, over here!

text: (Cutscene ends)

speaker: Mem
line: Phew, that was really close...

speaker: Phainon
line: It's too early to relax... The Flame Reaver is a master in the art of deceit. Even Mydei may not be able to restrain them.

speaker: Phainon
line: I never thought I would leave him alone on the battlefield twice... But now isn't the time to be thinking about this.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Tribbie didn't follow us... Does she intend to stay above to help Mydei?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), can you still run?

speaker: Panicked Citizen
line: Protect us... Sky father, save us!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Someone is calling for help... Over there!

speaker: Phainon
line: The black tide creatures are threatening the people...

speaker: Phainon
line: We can't just stand by and watch... Let's end this quickly!

text: (Enter battle againstBlack Tide's Corroded Axe×1,Black Tide's Decrepit Bow×1,Black Tide Council×2,Tide-Eroded Blade×3)
(During battle)

speaker: Phainon
line: That rainbow barrier...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Is that Hyacine's power?

text: Console the frightened residents

title: Step Description
content: Shielded by Castorice's power, Mydei buys us time against the Flame Reaver, enabling our escape from Dawncloud to Marmoreal Palace. Though this place too lies in ruins, we're relieved to find Okhema's residents unharmed under Hyacine's protection.The Vortex of Genesis awaits just a short distance away — we must hasten our steps.

speaker: Phainon
line: Everyone, you're all safe... for now.

speaker: Panicked Citizen
line: Th—Thank you, Lord Phainon!

speaker: Phainon
line: It is someone else who deserves your thanks. Those black tide creatures just now couldn't breach this barrier...

speaker: Phainon
line: This energy feels familiar, like the luminous arts that Hyacine uses to treat people... but it is much more powerful.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Looks like she did it.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Yeah.

speaker: Phainon
line: Citizens! My companions and I can't stay long. Before reinforcements arrive...

speaker: Phainon
line: Please do not step out of this barrier. This is a miracle left by the demigod Hyacine... Please trust her conviction.

speaker: Calm Citizen
line: Miss Hyacine has also become a demigod like Lady Aglaea...?

speaker: Calm Citizen
line: We understand... We will not leave her protection until you return, Lord Phainon!

speaker: Phainon
line: I... won't make empty promises. I might not be able to return in the near future...

speaker: Phainon
line: But even if there's no perfect solution... I will make a choice that fulfills this mission.

text: Return to the lower floor of Marmoreal Palace
(Speak with the citizens, optional)

speaker: Panicked Citizen
line: We trust you, Lord Phainon! No matter what choice you make...

speaker: Panicked Citizen
line: We'll be waiting for your return!

text: (Continue toward objective)

speaker: Phainon
line: The people in the market... must also be suffering.

speaker: Phainon
line: I hope Hyacine can protect them in time...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Chartonus!

speaker: Phainon
line: Quick, let's go check on him!

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Phainon
line: Chartonus! Hang in there!

speaker: Chartonus
line: Ah... Returned, Phainon...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Burning... the holy city is. To resist... I did all I could.

speaker: Phainon
line: You shouldn't be on the frontline at your age, Grand Craftsman... Where are the citizens? What's the situation at Marmoreal Market?

speaker: Chartonus
line: Organizing their escape... the holy city guards are. But... where to flee to, no one knows...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Descended from the sky, the rainbow barrier did. Protected the people... but alleviated the fear, it could not.

speaker: Phainon
line: I fear this is Amphoreus's end, Chartonus. There is only one way to save our home...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Ah... Finally come true, the sky father's prophecy...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Go... for miracle. Deliverer... you shall become.

speaker: Chartonus
line: One more thing... there is.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Waiting at the Vortex of Genesis... Lady Trinnon is.

speaker: Chartonus
line: Kephale's Coreflame is safe... she said.

speaker: Phainon
line: Trinnon...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Black tide creatures... Prepare for battle!

speaker: Chartonus
line: Urgent... the situation is. Leave them to me... the monsters.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: But...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Died... I should have. Kept me here... the power of the rainbow light did.

speaker: Chartonus
line: But if destined... inescapable, death is...

speaker: Chartonus
line: Why not... leave behind some glory?

speaker: Phainon
line: You've been forging nothing but glory your entire life, old friend — for others, and for yourself. May you never see the slightest glimpse of war in the new world.

speaker: Phainon
line: Farewell, Grand Craftsman.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let us depart... to the Chrysos Heirs' baths!

speaker: Chartonus
line: For battle... these hands were not meant...

speaker: Chartonus
line: But, if to protect the holy city's future, they are needed...

speaker: Chartonus
line: To the final moment... I will fight!

text: (If the player attempts to leave)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Chartonus has made up his mind...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ We have to keep moving forward, (Trailblazer)!

text: (Continue toward objective)

speaker: Phainon
line: Chartonus said that Trinnon had news of the Coreflame...

speaker: Phainon
line: As expected... Miss Cipher did not fail her mission!

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The Chrysos Heirs' baths... Not a soul in here.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Those translucent structures are here too...

speaker: Mem
line: These buildings...

speaker: Mem
line: I can feel it... Their memories are dissipating.

text: Buildings... have memories too?

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: Yes... the textures of memories are preserved within all things in Amphoreus. Even a single brick or tile holds countless traces of the past.

text: Will this spread to other places?

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: I'm not sure... In any case, none of this feels right.

children.speaker: Mem
children.line: The textures of memories are preserved within all things in Amphoreus... Even a single brick or tile holds countless traces of the past.

speaker: Phainon
line: There are no citizens trapped here, nor any signs of black tide creatures... We have no reason to linger here.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's head downstairs... The bath chamber isn't far away.

text: Head to the Vortex of Genesis and complete the "Era Nova"

title: Step Description
content: The Flame Reaver stands before us once more, which can only mean...Go now, (Trailblazer), help Phainon complete the "Era Nova"!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The baths' waters are conveying sorrow and despair in ways I can barely comprehend...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I'm getting a vague sense of foreboding here.

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Mem
line: Th—They caught up to us!

speaker: Mem
line: Don't tell me that Mydei...

speaker: Phainon
line: Tsk...

text: Can we defeat them head-on?
You guys go ahead. I'll shore up the rear!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ Phainon, take (Trailblazer) to the Vortex of Genesis. I will stay here and hold them off.

speaker: Phainon
line: Dan Heng, you...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Don't hesitate, Phainon — you still shoulder the mission of the Era Nova.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ▶ We don't know if the Flame Reaver has any clones up ahead... (Trailblazer), stay close to Phainon and keep him safe.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Amphoreans often speak of "destiny"... The destiny of the Trailblaze is to bind the life and death of every world to our own existence.

text: Such a hasty farewell... I won't allow it.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: This isn't farewell. Don't worry. I'll do everything in my power to survive.

text: Everyone in the Crew is still waiting for our return!

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: I don't intend to say goodbye forever to anyone. Don't worry. I'll do everything in my power to survive.

text: I'll stay together with you...

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: Someone has to buy time.

children.speaker: Dan Heng
children.line: ▶ It's not goodbye forever, (Trailblazer). Don't worry. I'll do everything in my power to survive.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Time... running out...

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Everything... will be reset.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ You better keep your word, Dan Heng...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ You cannot die here!

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Wherever there's flowing water, I can harness its power to purge the filth.

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: This power... Unfamiliar...

speaker: Flame Reaver
line: Who... are you...?

speaker: Dan Heng
line: Even if I were just a passing traveler, I would not hesitate to lay down my life and protect the unfamiliar world beneath my feet... This is the destined course that a Trailblazer cannot escape.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: I am a Nameless, and what I'm going to do...

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...is to defend all the hopes that are on the verge of fading away.

speaker: Phainon
line: Follow me.

text: (If the player attempts to leave)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ We have to get to the Vortex of Genesis quickly!

text: (Approach the marked location)

speaker: Determined Holy City Guard
line: Lord Phainon!

speaker: Loyal Holy City Guard
line: Finally, you're all back!

speaker: Phainon
line: Even in such desperate times, you still managed to keep your promise to me... I am grateful beyond words.

speaker: Mem
line: Phainon, what is this...

speaker: Phainon
line: The Flame Reaver is wreaking havoc in the city, and they still have many clones. Zeph, please get someone to inform Krateros, and have him lead the most elite guards to defend the city's passages...

speaker: Phainon
line: Until I complete the Coreflame ritual... please do everything you can to rescue the citizens in the city.

speaker: Zeph the Guard
line: Understood, Lord Phainon.

speaker: Phainon
line: Mnemosyne... Several citizens are trapped in the Garden of Life, and are temporarily seeking refuge under Hyacine's barrier. Can you dispatch some people to evacuate them?

speaker: Phainon
line: Though... I also don't know where to shelter them.

speaker: Mnemosyne the Guard
line: Leave this to us, Lord Phainon. Just focus on your own mission.

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ All right. As for (Trailblazer) and Dan Heng, I'll also leave them to you.

text: What in the world is going on...
Are you hiding something from me, Phainon?

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ My apologies, (Trailblazer). I acted on my own this time.

speaker: Phainon
line: I prepared for the worst before the fight against Aquila. Even if there came a day when Okhema was taken by the black tide...

speaker: Phainon
line: As long as we defeated Aquila, lifting the sky's curse... you and Dan Heng would at least have a chance to get home safely.

text: You... already made plans?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Yes. I knew you'd object, so I didn't inform you beforehand. My apologies.

text: The final lap is always the hardest...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Sorry, I know you must dislike leaving things unfinished, which is why I didn't inform you beforehand.

text: The progress bar is already at 95%, and you're leaving me on a cliffhanger?

speaker: Phainon
line: I know this is hard to accept... but even if it means being resented for the rest of my life, I still have to be responsible for you.

speaker: Phainon
line: Friend, you and Dan Heng taught me the spirit of Trailblazing. The best decision I ever made in my life was when I followed my intuition and chose to trust you.

speaker: Phainon
line: Dan Heng told me many stories about the adventures of the Nameless. Two of them left a deep impression on me: "Belobog" and "Penacony"...

speaker: Phainon
line: The first story taught me that the fate of a world should be in the hands of its people. And... even if the Nameless are willing to risk everything for an unfamiliar world, in the end you still have to embark on a new journey and go to the next world that needs saving.

speaker: Phainon
line: Because that's your mission... the Path you follow.

speaker: Phainon
line: In the second story, Dan Heng told me about the few Nameless who sacrificed their lives for the "prison world." I know very well that the two of you are willing to make the same choice for Amphoreus.

speaker: Phainon
line: After hearing those stories, I made up my mind...

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ I won't let your journey end here, (Trailblazer). Somewhere beyond the sky, where Amphoreans have never reached, there are many people waiting for you to come home.

speaker: Phainon
line: The prophecy has always remained shrouded in ambiguity — even if the twelfth Coreflame is returned, no one knows how the Era Nova will manifest... let alone if the miracle will extend its favor to two visitors from beyond the sky.

speaker: Phainon
line: Before stepping into a fate unknown, the last thing I can do... is help you return to your family.

text: And even if we ignore the prophecy, we can't go back now.

speaker: Zeph the Guard
line: ▶ Please don't worry, (Trailblazer). Lord Phainon has already entrusted Elder Lygus to fix your transport.

speaker: Mnemosyne the Guard
line: ▶ Lady Trinnon's Century Gate is open on the main street outside Okhema's walls, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Phainon
line: I'm sorry for making such an unreasonable request of you all. But we live in an imperfect age... where there is never a perfect choice.

text: I have the right to witness the ending of this Trailblaze.
Don't try to stop me from coming back like that.
A hero... doesn't have to bear everything alone.
You've changed into someone different from yourself, Phainon.

speaker: Phainon
line: Every one of us has the right to make our own choices. If you can't accept my decision on your behalf...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Then use your choice to open up a new path — that's what you're best at, right?

speaker: Phainon
line: Regardless... Dan Heng is still holding on for his life... Don't keep him waiting too long, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Phainon
line: One day, I hope we will reunite under the constellations... When that time comes, we can hold a belated victory feast. How about that?

speaker: Phainon
line: The spirit water... has dried up?

speaker: Phainon
line: Blast! Why is nothing going right...

speaker: Phainon
line: Calm down... There might be another way in. The closest ritual basin, the other Chrysos Heirs'...

speaker: Trinnon
line: ...Snowy.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Trinnon!

speaker: Phainon
line: I thought you'd be waiting at the Vortex of Genesis. Are you all right?

speaker: Trinnon
line: When Okhema's night descended... all the spirit water dried up along with it. We anticipated that you'd be on edge, so we came ahead to wait for you.

speaker: Phainon
line: Heh... You've always been the ones who knew me best.

speaker: Phainon
line: Kephale's Coreflame... You know where it is?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Yes. Little Ciphy protected the Coreflame well... No one would be able to guess where she stashed it.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Bartholos! You can come on out!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...Heeheehee! I don't have to pretend to be an envelope anymore! That was suffocating!

speaker: Phainon
line: Bartholos!? What in the world...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Hey, you'd better watch your tone, brat! That Coreflame that the entire world is after...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: ...is currently nestled in the depths of my bottomless tummy!

speaker: Phainon
line: This certainly was... unexpected.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Huh? Your reaction's too composed. It's completely different from what I was anticipating!

speaker: Trinnon
line: Bartholos... Snowy still doesn't know the truth behind Okhema's eternal daylight.

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Ah... you're right. Then you'd better strap in and listen up, brat!

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: That girl, Cifera, spun a grand lie that deceived all of Amphoreus...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: She tricked all of you into believing that that giant ball on Kephale's back would cast light over Okhema forever...

speaker: "Spirithief" Bartholos
line: Not just that... Heeheehee, she even managed to fool that dumb ascension trial, and allowed me, the great Zagreus ... to survive!

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: ...Hey, brat?

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: You... still no reaction from you? Dang it! You're no fun at all. I'm sorely disappointed!

speaker: Phainon
line: So, for the last thousand years... what maintained Okhema's eternal daylight was not Kephale's miracle, but Cipher's lie woven using the divine authority of Trickery...

speaker: Phainon
line: But now, the lie has come undone. Which means...

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: You didn't guess wrong... Cifera has already passed, and all her lies have scattered to the winds like ash.

speaker: Phainon
line: But you just said, you — Zagreus — relied on Cipher's lie to keep living. If she is already...

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: Heeheehee... Guess you're not as smart as I thought, brat. Don't forget. I am one of the Twelve Titans of Amphoreus...

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: And this Coreflame in my belly... Is it not the core that maintains a Titan's life and divinity?

speaker: Phainon
line: Ah...

speaker: Phainon
line: So, you're... going to hand the Coreflame over to us, just like that?

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: Heeheehee... Just so! How about it? Let's hear some groveling gratitude, eh?

speaker: Phainon
line: Why? In the myths... Zagreus was the most cowardly and shameful of the Titans.

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: Hey, stop slandering me with those fabricated tales! My pursuits are far greater than one measly life...

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: Let me tell you then! My lifelong ambition... was to work with Cipher to conjure the greatest trick in the world!

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: Assume this world holds a hundred million possibilities, and no matter how one looks at it, ninety-nine million, nine hundred ninety-nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine of them all point to outcomes of certain destruction...

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: But! With an exquisitely brilliant scheme, we fooled all the fools, villains, and disasters of this world, and achieved that one-in-a-hundred-million possibility...

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: This... is the "miracle" I wished to achieve in my life's pursuit, even at the cost of turning into this!

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: Take the Coreflame with you, brat! Go finish your mission!

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: Remember this well... What saved Amphoreus wasn't the grace of that simpleton Kephale, nor was it the babbling of that child Oronyx...

speaker: Zagreus, Embers of Trickery
line: ...It was the divine power of me, scorned by all... and the millennium-long lie of a cat-eared thief!

text: Zagreus takes out the Coreflame that belonged to Kephale, which was hidden in their stomach.
Their divine body, reduced to the form of a Spirithief, disappears into dust. Their unbridled laughter fades away in the wind...

speaker: Phainon
line: Strife. Death. Trickery...

speaker: Phainon
line: So those signs deemed as harbingers of calamity... will also leave behind marks in the tale of deliverance.

speaker: Trinnon
line: With this, the final Coreflame can be returned to its rightful place.

speaker: Trinnon
line: The spirit water in the holy city has all dried up... We can try to break the sealing magic of Phagousa's priests... and use the Century Gate to send you into the Vortex of Genesis.

speaker: Trinnon
line: But... that will likely exhaust any remaining power of Janus that we have. After that, the rest is up to you, Snowy.

speaker: Phainon
line: Farewells... I've almost grown numb to them at this point. Right now... I can't even utter a plain goodbye.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Snowy...

speaker: Phainon
line: Don't worry, Trinnon. I'm no longer the empty shell that Aglaea brought back to Okhema.

speaker: Phainon
line: For every companion who couldn't reach the end, their conviction to save the world became a part of me, piecing together the soul I once lost.

speaker: Phainon
line: I lost my home village, but you, Aglaea, and everyone else created a second home for me.

speaker: Phainon
line: Now that this home is also in danger... it is my turn to repay your kindness and create a new world that can carry everyone's wishes.

speaker: Phainon
line: I hope that, in that new world, a new sun will rise, bringing one dawn after another to all.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Snowy, you've grown into the person Agy always dreamed of.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Indeed, we don't need to say goodbye here...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Because, even without the prophecy, we have the confidence to say... you will become that rising sun.

speaker: Trinnon
line: And all of us... will see each other again "tomorrow."

text: (Cutscene plays)

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: How...

children.speaker: Trinnon
children.line: All shall bid farewell to one...

children.speaker: Trinnon
children.line: And that person alone will witness the miracle...

children.speaker: Trinnon
children.line: ...Such is destiny.

children.speaker: Mydei
children.line: Become the dawn... Deliverer.

text: (Cutscene ends)

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: Burning skies, shattered statues, corpses strewn everywhere... What a mess. If this is what the inside of "Amphoreus" looks like, it's truly shocking.

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: To be honest, I was initially skeptical. But right now, I'm starting to see your point...

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: Screwy.

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: If that's the case, Herta, do you now have enough reason to believe my conjecture about the true nature of "Amphoreus"?

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: Let's not expand on that topic just yet. That Intellitron — Lygus, was it? He's not completely dead. That was probably a fake body. Something behind it... is still defying us.

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: I must admit, even if both of us worked together, it wouldn't be a simple task piercing through its defenses.

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: For now, we can only observe this world as bystanders.

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: I knew we should've brought Stephen along.

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: No wonder the Garden of Recollection wanted to work with the Astral Express — without the power of the Trailblaze, it'd be impossible to unearth this place's secrets. But in the end, the Garden emerged unscathed, and it was the Nameless who got burnt. Curiosity definitely killed Aki.

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: That big guy over there — the black ball spewing meteors — you think it's got anything to do with the Lord Ravager?

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: Alas, without sufficient computational power in the stream projection, I am unable to analyze the Path Energy.

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: Suggestion: The immediate priority now is to find the whereabouts of the two Nameless. Research priority on the Destruction can be lowered. Every second counts, before that Intellitron's preventative measures kick in.

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: All right, all right, stop making a fuss. How many times have we collaborated, and when did it ever not end in a perfect outcome?

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: Why not add another mission objective while we're at it: The card-playing Memokeeper told me that the frozen Trailblazer girl might just also be trapped inside Amphoreus.

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: If time allows, I will also investigate March 7th's whereabouts.

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: Herta, do you hear that? A wave of desperate cries from the heart of the mountain city. The lives there are undergoing intense suffering.

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: Conclusion: The butterfly has already flapped its wings, and an impending storm closes in. The Nameless are important allies, and you and I have matters to attend to, Herta. I beseech you...

speaker: Screwllum's Projection
line: In moments when a choice needs to be made, one must not be distracted due to personal interests.

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: Of course I know that.

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: Tsk, fate really is a game of dice, Screwy. Who'd have thought? That thing once sowed chaos across the cosmos, causing the Intelligentsia Guild to splinter and disintegrate. It wasn't until I cracked the solitary waves theory that its lingering effects were put to an end.

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: Yet, in a forgotten corner of the cosmos, one slipped through the net and remained operational. And it was this machine that eventually became the cradle for the birth of a certain Lord Ravager...

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: The source of Amphoreus' tragedy...

speaker: Herta's Projection
line: ...is an Emperor's Scepter that survived to this day.
This is... what the world looked like originally?
And what are you doing here?
...Answer my question, Lygus.

speaker: Lygus
line: Ah... Another hero has arrived at the Vortex. I can no longer remember how many times this has happened.

speaker: Lygus
line: The author of each epic, as the prophecy has foretold, stays their pen at this point.

speaker: Lygus
line: Just like each cycle of the extrapolation, in accordance to THEIR primordial design, ends here.

speaker: Lygus
line: No need to panic, Lord Phainon. I stepped into this space purely for one purpose: To witness the prophecy's Miracle of Genesis.
...You've never expressed interest in the Flame-Chase Journey. When my companions and I ran, bled, and sacrificed for the Coreflames, you never so much as lifted a finger.
An indifferent observer, an Antikytheran who is neutral till the end... Why would you suddenly express concern for the Chrysos Heirs' mission?

speaker: Lygus
line: When that lone swordmaster left everything behind, plunging into a sea of madness, I was on the shore, listening. When that mighty lord shed his armor, filling the crevices of the earth with his iron bones, I was on the mountain top, gazing down.

speaker: Lygus
line: Across a thousand years of the Flame-Chase Journey, I have witnessed the ardor, resolve, division, and unity of the Chrysos Heirs with mine own eyes...

speaker: Lygus
line: Just as you were all born to shoulder the guidance of the prophecy, I too, having bathed in the gaze of distant stars, have seen the deepest, darkest of destinies...

speaker: Lygus
line: I will become the most loyal reader of the epics, a spectator voraciously consuming the valorous deeds of you heroes.
"The gaze of distant stars"...?

speaker: Lygus
line: One day, you will understand. But not now.

speaker: Lygus
line: At this moment, please disregard this observer, and finish what you must, Lord Phainon.
I once believed that as long as I chased the flames relentlessly, the fog before me would clear, and fate would reveal its truest form.
But along the way, we... they, all who passed, never once received the justice promised by the prophecy.

speaker: Lygus
line: I have perceived: Outside the Vortex, the world is collapsing, and the children of humanity are crying.

speaker: Lygus
line: But you, Lord Phainon, will bury the old world with that Coreflame, bringing all things into a gray unknown...
It doesn't matter. This cruel Flame-Chase Journey has made me abandon my fantasies. The future is not a paradise with a gentle west wind, waiting for us to step in...
If what lies ahead is a mass of chaos, I will tear it apart...
...Then usher in the first ray of blazing sunlight.

speaker: Lygus
line: All shall bid farewell to one, and that person alone will witness the miracle. Such is the will of fate.

speaker: Lygus
line: Yet this time, will an epic with endless cycles...
...Is it you?

speaker: Lygus
line: ...turn a new page?
...Of course.
This will be a romantic story like none that has come before...

speaker: Cyrene
line: You think so too, right?

text: Post-Mission

Messages The Astral Express Family Pom-Pom Everyone, the train car that entered Amphoreus is still out of contact Himeko March 7th's condition also seems to be getting worse Can you read this message? (Trailblazer) Himeko! Welt! Look at me! Can you read the messages I sent!? The world is doomed! (Trailblazer) Himeko! Welt! Come save me! Amphoreus is doomed! Message failed to send. Himeko How's the situation on your end, Welt? Welt Things are going well so far. Herta invited Screwllum to assist us, and we had a detailed chat in the seclusion zone. Both geniuses contributed with their knowledge. We're now closer to clearing up the mystery surrounding Amphoreus. However... there's a lot of unexpected information. It's hard to explain everything in a text message. I'll send you the meeting notes as a video right now. Himeko Understood Can I watch if I go to the space station? (Trailblazer) Help me out, Space Anchor. I want to head to the space station and check the meeting records too Message failed to send.
